thread.section_title: ACB 54 Report: Mamed Khalidov dominates, Shoaib Yousaf impresses, Rob Whiteford makes a statement – Metro
thread.title: ACB 54 Report: Mamed Khalidov dominates, Shoaib Yousaf impresses, Rob Whiteford makes a statement
thread.title_full: ACB 54 Report: Mamed Khalidov dominates, Shoaib Yousaf impresses, Rob Whiteford makes a statement

author: Jim Edwards
title: ACB 54 Report: Mamed Khalidov dominates, Shoaib Yousaf impresses, Rob Whiteford makes a statement
text:
Mamed Khalidov celebrates his win (Picture: ACB) Twenty-three fights, seven hours, and more unforgettable moments than you could’ve ever thought possible – ACB 54 delivered one of the most action-packed nights of MMA ever held on British soil and will live long in the memory of all those in attendance and watching around the world.
The main event of the evening saw two of Europe’s finest middleweight fighters in action with Poland’s king Mamed Khalidov taking on British fighter, Luke Barnatt.
The fight had been talked up for weeks as one of biggest fights in European MMA history, but when it went down only 21 seconds were needed.
Both Barnatt and Khalidov wasted little time from the outset and the stood in the pocket trading strikes.
With barely eighteen seconds on the clock, the critical strike landed as Khalidov connected with a huge overhand right to send Barnatt staggering back against the cage.
Incredible by Mamed Khalidov! Wasted no time to claim victory in the main event of #ACB54 ! https://t.co/NsdDUUkp6c 
— ACB fighting league (@acb_league) March 11, 2017 
The Polish fighter then swarmed him, landing a few more strikes before dropping him to the mat.
Referee Herb Dean stepped in to call the fight in what was a well-timed stoppage despite Barnatt contesting the decision when he was back on his feet.
The crowd, who were heavily populated by Polish fans, cheered to the rafters as the rightful king of Polish MMA celebrated in the cage after.
Loughnane smashes through Wilkinson In the co-main event of the evening, two British featherweights rekindled an old rivalry as Brendan Loughnane and Mike Wilkinson went toe-to-toe.
The fight went only two minutes and thirty seconds and the whole time only one man looked like he’d win it.
Loughnane dominated from the outset and used leg kicks to get into range to unload strikes.
Midway through the first round, Loughnane landed a huge knee and Wilkinson hit the deck.
#ACB54 – Brendan Loughnane KO’s Mike Wilkinson in 1R. The knee at the end ! pic.twitter.com/EAC2TzRU36 
— Jolassanda (@Jolassanda) March 11, 2017 
Wilkinson tried to get to his feet, but Loughnane swarmed him with strikes and the referee called the fight off at exactly two minutes and thirty seconds.
It was a stunning performance by Loughnane.
Yousaf lights up Manchester IMMAF world championship gold medalist Shoaib Yousaf took his professional record to 2-0 with a clinical win over Javonne Morrison.
Yousaf dealt with Morrison’s early onslaught well and when his opportunity came he finished the fight with a stunning head kick and strikes combination.
ACB 54 – Shoaib Yousaf 1R TKO (head kick + punches) (vs. Javonne Morrison ) Morrison is not happy with this stoppage pic.twitter.com/KfPT0dRrIX 
— Jolassanda (@Jolassanda) March 11, 2017 
The youngster’s traveling fans, ‘The Yousaf Army’, went crazy in the stands as he simply walked around the cage as if he’d barely been for a Sunday night.
Whiteford steamrolls Phan and calls for UFC return Robert Whiteford is targeting a return to the UFC (Picture: Getty) Another man making a big statement was last evening was the Scotsman, Robert Whiteford.
The former UFC man was released by the company in the middle of 2016, but with last evening’s performance, he could well find himself back in the UFC Octagon soon.
Whiteford wasted little time dealing with a tricky opponent and fellow former UFC man, Nam Phan.
The Scotsman blitzed Phan early, caught him with an uppercut and then pushed him up against the cage.
Rob Whiteford chokes out Nam Phan in 21 seconds – #ACB54 . Welp. pic.twitter.com/YJyV0HVq7r 
— caposa (@Grabaka_Hitman) March 11, 2017 
From there Whiteford applied a standing guillotine choke and Phan was rendered unconscious with just 21 seconds on the clock.
It was a stunning win and Whiteford took the time to tell Metro.co.uk afterward that he felt he’d done more than enough to get a recall back to the UFC for the upcoming UFC Glasgow show on July 16.
Massive upset as Rogers defeated Home favourite Saul Rogers was stunned by his late replacement opponent (Picture: Getty) Former The Ultimate Fighter contestant Saul Rogers was also in action last evening as he faced last minute replacement, Aurel Pirtea.
The odds were heavily stacked in the favor of the British fighter with the Romanian getting the call up on just 48-hours notice and Rogers looked in control after a dominant round one.
In round two though everything got turned on it’s head.
What an upset! Aurel Pirtea defeats local favourite Saul Rogers! #ACB54 https://t.co/qguXtqn1Jv 
— ACB fighting league (@acb_league) March 11, 2017 
Rogers dove in for a takedown, but Pirtea read it and quickly put him in a deep guillotine choke.
The British fighter simply had nowhere to go and after 30 seconds of struggling, he was left limp and unconscious.
It was arguably the biggest upset of the night and Rogers left the cage looking dejected and understandably disappointed to have suffered the second loss of his career.
Best of the rest On a breathless night of 23 fights, there were also big wins for British fighters Dean Garnett, Azi Thomas and Kane Mousah.
Spinning back kick KO by Dean Garnett. Liver shot. #ACB54 pic.twitter.com/UQEAzAOwPm 
— caposa (@Grabaka_Hitman) March 11, 2017 
Garnett’s finish especially was one to be remembered as he dominated his previously undefeated opponent Michael Tobin in every exchange on the feet before finishing him in the second round with a crazy spinning back kick.
ACB 54 Full Results 
Mamed Khalidov def. Luke Barnett – TKO (strikes, R1)
Brendan Loughnane def. Mike Wilkinson – TKO (Knee & punches, R1)
Asambek Saidov def. Ion Pascu – Unanimous decision
Aurel Pirtea def. Saul Rogers – Sub (Guillotine, R2)
Ali Bagov def. Bubba Jenkins – Sub (Reverse triangle, R2)
Joshua Aveles def. Amirkhan Adaev – Split decision
Batraz Agnew def. Max Nunes via TKO (Strikes, R2)
Rakhman Dzhanaev def. Adam Zajac – TKO (Doctor stoppage, R2)
Andrew DeVent def. Danny Mitchell – KO (Punches, R1)
Murad Kalamov def. Niko Gjoka – Sub (Triangle-choke, R2)
Kane Mousah def. Lewis Monarch – Unanimous decision
Dean Garnett def. Michael Tobin – TKO (Spinning side kick, R2)
Ibrahim Chuzhigaev def. David Mitchell – TKO (Punches, R3)
Rob Whiteford def. Nam Phan FW – Sub (Guillotine, R1)
Mukhumat Vakhaev def. Tanner Boser – Split decision
Shoaib Yousaf def. Javonne Morrison – TKO (Head-kick & punches, R1)
Ashley Reece def. James Lewis – TKO (Punches, R2)
Chris Bungard def. Iain Feenan – Sub (Triangle-choke, R1)
Azi Thomas def. Eden Newton – TKO (Punches, R1)
Aaron Aby def. Coner Hignet – Split decision
Gaz Corran def. Shaun Hampton – Unanimous decision
Jenaid Ebanks def. Marcin Prostko – Sub (Rear-naked choke, R2)
Cal Ellenor def. Declan Williams – Sub (Rear-naked choke, R1) MORE: ACB 54: Live results and action from Luke Barnatt vs Mamed Khalidov 
MORE: Robert Whiteford insists he has sent message to UFC after 21-second win at ACB 54
